page.title: 05Road Transport in Ilford
page.content: {Traffic Congestion in S.E. Ilford. Like many urban areas, we suffer considerably from this especially during morning and afternoon peak periods. In adition, as most housing here was built prior to World War II, there is{anadequate provision for cars in residential areas. Thus on-street parking combined with{narrow streets causes frequent problems. Heavy rush hour traffic often causes {long delays at intersections}along the A12 and the High Road. Attempts have been made to improve the flow along some local routes by mini-roundabouts: {there is major road re-development}in the centre of Ilford but much more needs to be done. More restricted street parking and more car parks, with redirected traffic flows, could ease the problem in many locations. MAYFIELD HIGH SCHOOL
